summary: This is a court order from Judge Alison J. Nathan regarding logistical arrangements for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial. It addresses public access, overflow rooms, and coordination for alleged victims and the defendant's family to attend the trial, in accordance with COVID-19 protocols.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case referenced in the court order.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge who issued the order regarding trial access and logistics.

persons.name: Wendy Olson
persons.context: The contact person in the U.S. Attorney's Office for coordinating alleged victim access to the trial.

persons.name: Joseph Pecorino
persons.context: The contact person in the District Court for coordinating access for the defendant's family and alleged victims.

connections.description: Judge Nathan is presiding over the criminal case against defendant Maxwell.

events.title: Court Order on Trial Access
events.description: Judge Alison J. Nathan issues an order detailing logistical arrangements for public, victim, and family access to the upcoming Ghislaine Maxwell trial, in line with COVID-19 protocols.

locations: United States District Court Southern District of New York
keyFacts: The document is a court order from October 14, 2021, related to the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell.
Judge Alison J. Nathan outlines plans for public access to the trial, including the use of overflow rooms with live feeds due to COVID-19 protocols.
Access for alleged victims is to be coordinated through the Victim Witness Unit (Wendy Olson) and the District Executive's Office (Joseph Pecorino).
Defense counsel may coordinate access for Ghislaine Maxwell's family members through the District Executive's Office.
